Posted By: thew00tninja (5/2/2010 7:06:02 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Great art, and managed to win me a sealed event : (twas a FNM event though, so all I got for my troubles was a [Bloodbraid Elf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodbraid Elf), but I digress)   
The ability to stop activated abilities in any case is nice, but in RoE it's quite a powerhouse. Literally the only games I lost when I played Linvala were games in which my opponent managed to kill her.   
Outside of the land of envokers, levelers, and eldrazi spawn, there is clearly less potential for her to shine. But a 3/4 flier for four is, as others have said, quite spectacular.  
  
5/5 imo. The art is what tips the scale.
posts.html:

Outside of the land of envokers, levelers, and eldrazi spawn, there is clearly less potential for her to shine. But a 3/4 flier for four is, as others have said, quite spectacular.

5/5 imo. The art is what tips the scale.

posts.post_content: Great Art and Card. Definitely worth building an Angel deck around her (and her more aggressive sister Baneslayer Angel). She slows down enough decks in order for you to prepare / build up for a m\*\*\*ive counter attack. With enough mana shut down 4 other colours with 4 copies of Iona, Shield of Emeria for total domination.

posts.post_content: I just got her two days ago!! I'm sooo happy she's bad A$$ I can't wait to use her. I think that she has one of the strongest abilities EVER on a Magic card. Ya, Annihilator is friggin awesome and so are mana abilities, token gen., power boost/weakener, etc. etc. But this prevents ALL of it from even happening! Therefore I have to contest that this is one of or THE best ability ever printed. But to play devil's advocate, she does rely on other cards to be good. If they didn't have abilities then it would be horrible. 5/5
posts.html:

Posted By: Nickajack (5/4/2010 8:01:38 AM)
Rating:

@OMFGrhombus:
If by looking different than the other angels of the Zendikar set you mean the halos, it is because of flavor. The angels of Zendikar with halos over their eyes have those halos there as a symbol of their blindness to the truth of the "gods" they serve, as those gods are actually Eldrazi. Linvala, Deathless Angel, the angels on Harmless ***ault and Induce Despair,and Zendikar angel Iona, Shield of Emeria all are without halos around their eyes because they are freed from the blindness the angels once experienced. (Source: "The Defiance of Angels" off of Daily MTG: http://www.wizards.com/Magic/Magazine/Article.aspx?x=mtg/daily/stf/86).

@Orichalkos:
Linvala will not stop allies' abilities, as they are triggered abilities that trigger when another ally enters the battlefield. Linvala stops activated abilities (i.e. have costs such as "{T}: Prodigal Pyromancer deals 1 da... (see all)
